column2: 2. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 3. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column6: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.
column10: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.

column2: 5. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column8: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.

column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 7. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 9. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 10. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
21. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 22. When you are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching, you should use your parking lights.
23. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column6: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.

column2: 25. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.
